comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content:
Great shot of the first Friedrichshafen with a fully enclosed fuselage, this is the FF 17a in its first single float version seen here at the Bodensee-Wettbewerb 1914 [The contest for seaplanes at the Bodensee in 1914) before the war. This machine was later modified to a more conventional twin float seaplane and than designated FF 17b. It is great to see this picture fully, that is most of the books which print this picture have left and right pieces cut off. 

The machine in its single float form (FF 17a) was hastily impressed in the German Marine service after the start of the war. It acquired the Marinenummer '64'.
